repnme.cdata!:
Indonesia - Infrastructure Reconstruction
            Enabling Program Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Infrastructure
            Reconstruction Enabling Program Project for Indonesia were
            as follows: outcomes were moderately satisfactory, the risk
            to development outcome was moderate, the Bank performance
            was satisfactory, and the Borrower performance was also
            satisfactory. Some lessons learned included: In order to
            ensure the sustainability, as a medium term development
            objective, of built assets, mechanisms to allocate
            sufficient funds or establish a maintenance fund should be
            effectively designed, especially in environments where
            decentralization efforts are lagging. Also, it seems that a
            regionalized large infrastructure program such as this one
            are best suited in an environment where the capacity of the
            local government is sound and devolution of authority is
            real. In the end, and understandably, the emphasis in this
            project was always on the completion of the large building
            programs under institutional, budgetary and time pressures
            rather than on the sustainability of these assets after
            handover. The project did not put enough emphasis in
            effective training in infrastructure management, operation
            and maintenance of local government staff, as was
            underscored by the reduction of funding devoted to these
            activities. Local governments, on the other hand, did not
            allocate funds to these training activities. Capacity
            building in infrastructure management can only be effective
            when based on a sound analysis of the incentives and
            capacity of the local government, to which assets are to be
            handed over. It is recommended that in the future, local
            governments will allow for funding of capacity building
            programs in their medium term development plans to acquire
            the proper skills in infrastructure management.

repnme.cdata!:
Indonesia - Infrastructure Reconstruction
            Enabling Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
This paper seeks approval of the
            Regional Vice President (RVP) to extend the closing date for
            the Infrastructure Reconstruction Enabling Program (IREP)
            until December 31, 2011. IREP is financed through a grant of
            US$42.0 million from the Multi-Donor Trust Fund for Aceh and
            North Sumatra (MDF). The date of the grant agreement is July
            13, 2006. The original closing date was October 31, 2009,
            and has already been extended once until June 30, 2010. The
            extension is for a cumulative period of 26 months, and
            requires approval of the RVP under BP13.30. IREP's main
            objective is to enable the implementation of the
            Infrastructure Reconstruction Financing Facility (IRFF) by
            financing the technical assistance needed to perform the
            project implementation management activities including:
            procurement; financial management; quality control and
            quality assurance; safeguards framework assurance and
            monitoring; implementation monitoring; and the design and
            construction supervision of all activities under the IRFF.
            The IREP and IRFF projects are designed to go hand-in-hand.
            Extending the closing date of IREP to coincide with
            IRFF's new closing date is needed to continue providing
            implementation support towards satisfactory completion of
            all remaining works and achievement of the development
            objectives of the Aceh reconstruction.

12498393.trustfund:
TF055080-FUND FOR ACEH AND NORTH SUMATRA
            - APPRAISAL, SUPERVISION, COMPLETION,TF056894-INFRASTRUCTURE RECONSTRUCTION
            ENABLING PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Infrastructure
            Reconstruction Enabling Program (IREP) for Indonesia is to
            support the Bureau of Rehabilitation and Reconstruction for
            Aceh and Nias (BRR's) strategy for infrastructure
            reconstruction by providing high quality technical
            assistance (TA) services in infrastructure program
            management, planning, design, construction management,
            quality management and program monitoring. The project
            consists of the following components: Component 1) will
            support the mobilization of a highly skilled Infrastructure
            Program Management (IPM) team deployed within the existing
            BRR structure to coordinate infrastructure program and its
            activities at the macro level. Component 2: will finance a
            technical team to undertake the planning, project
            preparation, and implementation work for the West Coast
            logistical area. Component 3: will support mobilization of a
            technical team to undertake the planning, project
            preparation, and implementation work for the Nias logistical
            area. Component 4: will finance a technical consulting team
            to undertake the formulation, investment planning, design,
            and project implementation work of strategic infrastructure
            projects that are at the provincial and or national level,
            or with local governments not covered by components 2 and 3.
            Component 5: will strengthen BRR's capacity to put in
            place the financial management framework required to ensure
            that it meets all its fiduciary responsibilities with
            respect to this TA and other BRR investment projects.
